Plays > Masakiyo's Loyalty

– Click image to view.

Masakiyo's Loyalty

(八陣守護城) (Hachijin shugo no honjō)

Written By: Nakamura Gyogan (中村漁岸) , Sagawa Tōta (佐川藤太)

First Staged: 1807

Reference: Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 168, September 1979; Bunraku September 1979 Performance Program

Kashira:

Kenbishi (検非違使)

Musume (娘)

Yokanbei (与勘平)

Fukeoyama (老女形)

Bunshichi (文七)

Ōshūto (大舅)

Hagataki (端敵)

Kōmei (孔明)

Otoko tsume (男つめ)

Ofuku (お福)

Ōdanshichi (大団七)

Performances:

October 1979: Masakiyo's Loyalty

September 1979: Masakiyo's Loyalty

July 1992: Masakiyo's Loyalty

Scenes:

Kokingo's Death (小金吾討死)

The Sushi Shop (すしや)

Fushimi Inari Shrine (伏見稲荷)

The Shipping Agent at Daimotsu (渡海屋大物浦)

The Travel Dance on Mount Yoshino (道行初音の旅)

Characters:

Masakiyo Kato (加藤肥多守正清)

Yoshinari Mori (森三左衛門義成)

Hayase, a maid (腰元早瀬)

Saeda, a maid (腰元左枝)

Hinaginu (娘雛絹)

Gemba Marikawa (鞠川玄蕃)

Shigarami (妻柵)

Kazuenosuke Kato (加藤主計之介清郷)

Tokimasa Hojo (北条時政)

Imperial messenger (山蔭中納言)

Kyuma Hayabuchi (早淵久馬)

Spy (忍び)

Teruha, a maid (腰元照葉)

Miyuki, a maid (腰元深雪)

Yoshihiro Ouchi (大内冠者義弘)

Hazue (奥方葉末)

Nadaemon, in fact Motobei Kojima (船頭灘右衛門実は児嶋元兵衛政次)
